intro: Thesium transgariepinum, commonly known as the Transgariepina thistle, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly found in regions like Namibia and South Africa. The plant is characterized by its tall, erect stems and compound leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open grasslands and rocky areas.
